instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
I check and i don't see any sign of liquid in this board.
I have short to ground on PPBUS_G3H (F7140 - Pin 2).
I plugged the charger and check if i can find some warm component, no luck...
So, i inject Voltage on F7140 pin 2 and nothing happen, but i notice the cable i use for inject voltage start get warm.

I removed:
- R5450
- Q5500
- R7006
- Q3080
- L7130
- Q7130

No luck. The short still there.

Do you guys have any hint for me?

Thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Something must heat up. Is there a short on CPU Vcore?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Yes, i know, but nothing gets warm on ppbus_g3h
So, on PPVCC S0 CPU (C1096) Pin 1 i get 13.8Ω

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Have you tried freeze spray any where on the board? Never tried it myself on a computer board as I have never head to yet.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: So, on PPVCC S0 CPU (C1096) Pin 1 i get 13.8Ω

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] Any hint ? I take a look around the CPU and i can't find any bad caps or something like that.
I watch again a couple videos from [USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] about CPU short to ground, but no lucky.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: Inject voltage on PPBUS, something must get hot, nothing else to say.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: you can have a short but when you inject 12v on ppbus, how many amps/current is actually going in? 0.2a? 1a? 2a? or 0a?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
C7540/82 (lips test) and get a little warm.
I removed  and short disappeared.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: When i plug the charger, i get PPBUS_G3H (F7140).Pin 1 and 2 i get 3.3v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message: what do you get on L7130 pin 1

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
Update: Q7130 Get really hot. I just replaced. But nothing change.
I have green light
7100 The resistance between pins 17 and 18 - 3.4 ohm
                                                                27 and 28 - 20 ohm

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 - Short to ground on PPBUS_G3H
threads.message:
[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] You are right.
I get ppbus!
